text: Billal Brahimi (born 14 March 2000) is a French professional footballer who plays as a left-winger for Ligue 1 club Stade de Reims. ==Club career== Brahimi signed for Middlesbrough from Portuguese LigaPro side Leixões, having previously spent time in various amateur parisian sides. He made his debut for the club on 28 August 2018 in a 2–1 win over Rochdale in the EFL Cup, coming on as a substitute for Muhamed Bešić at the Riverside Stadium. On 25 July 2019, Brahimi moved to Ligue 1 club Stade de Reims in a free transfer, with Middlesbrough receiving compensation for the departure. Brahimi cited a desire to move closer to his family in France as the motivation behind the move. ==Style of play== Brahimi can play anywhere along the forward line, but has appeared most frequently for Middlesbrough's academy sides as a left-winger. ==Career statistics== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;" |- !rowspan=2|Club !rowspan=2|Division !rowspan=2|Season !colspan=2|League !colspan=2|National Cup !colspan=2|League Cup !colspan=2|Other !colspan=2|Total |- !Apps !Goals !Apps !Goals !Apps !Goals !Apps !Goals !Apps !Goals |- |Middlesbrough |Championship ||2018–19||0||0||0||0||1||0||0||0||1||0 |- !colspan="3"|Career totals !0!!0!!0!!0!!1!!0!!0!!0!!1!!0 |} ==References== ==External links== * Category:2000 births Category:Living people Category:French footballers Category:French expatriate footballers Category:Association football forwards Category:Middlesbrough F.C. players Category:Stade de Reims players Category:French expatriate sportspeople in England Category:Expatriate footballers in England Category:French people of Algerian descent Category:Footballers from Paris
